org.firstinspires.ftc.teamcode.APIs.PID

Class PidApi

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.firstinspires.ftc.teamcode.APIs.PID.PidApi

  • public class PidApi
extends java.lang.Object
    This class consists of a math API for a PID controller. The P (proportional), I (integral), and D (derivative) weights must be included in the constructor when instantiating an object of this class, but can be modified at any time with their respective methods. For more information on the PID controller, including the best way to tune it, please see https://gm0.org/en/latest/docs/software/control-loops.html (we are in no way affiliated with Game Manual 0, their article is just really useful).

      • PidApi

        public PidApi(double pGain,
              double iGain,
              double dGain,
              double targetErrorDeadzone)
        Instantiate a new PID object
        Parameters:
        pGain - The P gain for this new PID object
        iGain - The I gain for this new PID object
        dGain - The D gain for this new PID object
        targetErrorDeadzone - The value that when added or subtracted from the target value creates the "dead zone" of values which are considered to be at their target position

      • getLimitedControlLoopOutput

        public double getLimitedControlLoopOutput(double currentPosition,
                                          double targetPosition,
                                          double minValue,
                                          double maxValue)
        Calculate and return a limited output of the control loop based on the current and target positions
        Parameters:
        currentPosition - The current position
        targetPosition - The target position
        minValue - The minimum value that the output can be
        maxValue - The maximum value that the output can be
        Returns:
        The control loop output, but limited by the minimum and maximum values provided

      • getLimitedControlLoopOutput

        public double getLimitedControlLoopOutput(double currentPosition,
                                          double targetPosition,
                                          double minAndMaxValue)
        Calculate and return a limited output of the control loop based on the current and target positions
        Parameters:
        currentPosition - The current position
        targetPosition - The target position
        minAndMaxValue - The value to be both added and subtracted from zero, which will create the minimum and maximum output values
        Returns:
        The control loop output, but limited by the minimum and maximum values based on the value provided
